meanings.definition: Containing more strings or fibers than usual.
meanings.sent1: The old rope was stringier than the new one.
meanings.sent2: The fabric of the old shirt felt stringier than the soft blanket.
meanings.sent3: The stringier vines in the garden seemed to be playing tug-of-war with each other.
meanings.sent4: Her stringier hair resembled a wild tangle of branches in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The stringier texture of the spaghetti made it harder to twirl around the fork.

meanings.definition: Having a texture that is tough or chewy.
meanings.sent1: The overcooked steak was stringier than expected.
meanings.sent2: The bubblegum became stringier the longer you chewed it.
meanings.sent3: Trying to cut the stringier bread felt like slicing through rubber bands.
meanings.sent4: His stringier jerky was like chewing on a leather shoe.
meanings.sent5: The stringier beef jerky required extra effort to bite through.

meanings.definition: Having a taste that is sharp or harsh.
meanings.sent1: The medicine had a stringier flavor than the sweet syrup.
meanings.sent2: The bitter herbs left a stringier aftertaste in her mouth.
meanings.sent3: The stringier lemonade made her pucker up like a fish.
meanings.sent4: The stringier coffee was like a wake-up call for her taste buds.
meanings.sent5: The stringier vinegar made her eyes water with its acidity.
